content:
• Tuesday, July 23, 2013
  • SLXP

    S&P announces changes to some of its indexes: Salix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SLXP) will...

    S&P announces changes to some of its indexes: Salix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SLXP) will replace Gardner Denver (NYSE:GDI) in the S&P MidCap 400, Agree Realty (NYSE:ADC) will replace SLXP in the S&P SmallCap 600, and DXP Enterprises (NASDAQ:DXPE) will replace True Religion Apparel (NASDAQ:TRLG) in the SmallCap 600. SLXP +0.6%, ADC +1.5%, DXPE +0.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM
  • EA

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Electronic Arts (EA - earnings) expects FQ2 revenue of $975M and EPS...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Electronic Arts (EA - earnings) expects FQ2 revenue of $975M and EPS of $0.12, below a consensus of $976M and $0.15. FY14 guidance is for revenue of $4B and EPS of $1.20, in-line with consensus. 2) Altera (ALTR - earnings) expects FQ3 sales to rise 5%-9% Q/Q, in-line with a 7.2% consensus. 3) RF Micro (RFMD - earnings) expects FQ2 revenue of $305M-$310M and EPS of $0.10-$0.11 vs. a consensus of $306.8M and $0.10. 4) Linear (LLTC - earnings) expects FQ2 revenue to be up 2%-5% Q/Q, mostly above a 2.2% consensus. EA +7% AH. ALTR +1.5%. RFMD -0.7%. LLTC +1.5%. (PRs: Electronic Arts, Altera, RF Micro, Linear)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • TTHI

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TTHI +18%. VMW +11%. EVR +9%. UIS +6%. EA +6%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TTHI +18%. VMW +11%. EVR +9%. UIS +6%. EA +6%.
    After-hours top losers: PNRA -5%. GWAY -5%. SONS -4%. NG -4%. BRCM -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • CRUS

    Apple suppliers rally in AH trading after the company beats FQ3 estimates on the back of 31M...

    Apple suppliers rally in AH trading after the company beats FQ3 estimates on the back of 31M iPhone sales (above a ~26M consensus), and in spite of recording only 14.6M iPad sales (below an ~18M consensus). Apple's FQ4 guidance is light, but that was arguably priced in. CRUS +4.6% AH.  QCOM +0.8%. OVTI +1.1%. SWKS +1.4%. TQNT +0.6%. Qualcomm and TriQuint report tomorrow afternoon.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • SRPT

    Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) will update investors on the regulatory progress of...

    Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) will update investors on the regulatory progress of eteplirsen tomorrow on a conference call scheduled for 8 a.m. EDT. Shares -2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • DELL

    EMC +3.6% AH after VMware beats Q2 estimates and issues in-line Q3 and 2013 guidance. The...

    EMC +3.6% AH after VMware beats Q2 estimates and issues in-line Q3 and 2013 guidance. The numbers are being very well-received by investors in light of low expectations. EMC delivers its own Q2 report tomorrow morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) +3.2% AH after providing preliminary Q2 operating results. Met coal...

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) +3.2% AH after providing preliminary Q2 operating results. Met coal production is seen totaling ~2.9M metric tons, up 7% Q/Q, driven by a strong performance from its Alabama mines. Met coal cash cost of production per metric ton is expected to decline 10%-plus Q/Q, or more than $10/metric ton.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • KKR

    KKR Financial (KFN): Q2 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $137.2M misses by $2.8M. Shares...

    KKR Financial (KFN): Q2 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $137.2M misses by $2.8M. Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • UIS

    Unisys (NYSE:UIS): Q2 EPS of $0.91 beats by $0.22. Revenue of $859M (-7% Y/Y) beats by $20.73M....

    Unisys (NYSE:UIS): Q2 EPS of $0.91 beats by $0.22. Revenue of $859M (-7% Y/Y) beats by $20.73M. Shares +4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • ILMN

    More on Illumina's (NASDAQ:ILMN) Q2: Revenue beats comfortably. Gross margin falls 420 bps on a...

    More on Illumina's (NASDAQ:ILMN) Q2: Revenue beats comfortably. Gross margin falls 420 bps on a GAAP basis but only 140 bps ex-items. R&D falls 5% while SG&A rises 29% Y/Y. CEO Jay Flatley is "very pleased" with the company's H1 financial performance. FY13 outlook: Non-GAAP EPS of $1.68-1.72 (20% revenue growth) against consensus of $1.67/ share. Shares +4.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL): FQ3 EPS of $7.47 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $35.3B (+1% Y/Y) beats by...

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL): FQ3 EPS of $7.47 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $35.3B (+1% Y/Y) beats by $300M. 31.2M iPhones (above estimates), 14.6M iPads (below estimates), 3.8M Macs. Expects FQ4 revenue of $34B-$37B, below $37.1B consensus. Shares +3.2% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 42 Comments
  • IGT

    International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT): FQ3 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $579M (+9%...

    International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT): FQ3 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $579M (+9% Y/Y) misses by $5.3M. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • ILMN

    Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN): Q2 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $346M (+23% Y/Y) beats by...

    Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN): Q2 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $346M (+23% Y/Y) beats by $14.23M. Shares +3.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • PNRA

    More on Panera Bread's (NASDAQ:PNRA) Q2: Company-owned bakery-cafe comps +3.8% for the period...

    More on Panera Bread's (NASDAQ:PNRA) Q2: Company-owned bakery-cafe comps +3.8% for the period (4.3% check growth, transactions -0.5%). Net income +16% Y/Y. Franchise-operated bakery-cafe comps +3.5%. Two-year net bakery-cafe comps for company-owned stores and franchise-operated locations rise 10.9% and 8.3% respectively. Operating margin rises 60 bps for the quarter on lower SG&A. Outlook: Q3 and Q4 EPS of $1.32-1.36 and $2.05-2.11 respectively. Shares -4.47% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA): FQ1 EPS of -$0.40 beats by $0.20. Non-GAAP Revenue of $495M beats...

    Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA): FQ1 EPS of -$0.40 beats by $0.20. Non-GAAP Revenue of $495M beats by $41.08M. Shares +4.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom (BRCM): Q2 EPS of $0.70 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.09B (+6% Y/Y) misses by $10M....

    Broadcom (BRCM): Q2 EPS of $0.70 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.09B (+6% Y/Y) misses by $10M. Expects Q3 revenue of $2.05B-$2.2B, below $2.25B consensus. Shares -4.2% AH. CC at 4:45PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • VMW

    VMware (NYSE:VMW): Q2 EPS of $0.79 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.243B (+11% Y/Y) beats by $13M....

    VMware (NYSE:VMW): Q2 EPS of $0.79 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.243B (+11% Y/Y) beats by $13M. Expects Q3 revenue of $1.27B-$1.3B vs. $1.28B consensus. Expects 2013 revenue of $5.12B-$5.26B vs. $5.17B consensus. Shares +7% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 4 Comments
  • PNRA

    Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA): Q2 EPS of $1.74 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $589M (+11% Y/Y) misses...

    Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA): Q2 EPS of $1.74 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $589M (+11% Y/Y) misses by $7.01M. Shares -2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro's (TSO +1.6%) proposal to build a 120K bbl/day crude-by-rail complex at the Port of...

    Tesoro's (TSO +1.6%) proposal to build a 120K bbl/day crude-by-rail complex at the Port of Vancouver in Washington gains approval from the port’s board of commissioners. TSO's proposal comes amid increased scrutiny over crude-by-rail projects after a train hauling crude rolled from its parking spot earlier this month and crashed in Lac-Megantic, Quebec.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM

  • Gold (GLD +0.9%) continues its comeback tour, with a big move in the last 30 minutes pushing the...

    Gold (GLD +0.9%) continues its comeback tour, with a big move in the last 30 minutes pushing the metal into the green for the session and up to $1,344/ounce.  Technician Mark Newton calls this bounce the beginning of a longer-term bottoming process, and sees the metal back at $1,500 before October. The miners (GDX +2.5%) also continue a big move, inducing the blow-up of another triple-leveraged ETF, the DUST (DUST -7.2%), now off about 60% in less than a month.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 13 Comments
  • FCX

    Investors are digging Freeport McMoRan's (FCX +3.2%) Q2 report, as weaker Y/Y results via lower...

    Investors are digging Freeport McMoRan's (FCX +3.2%) Q2 report, as weaker Y/Y results via lower prices and volumes and higher costs already were anticipated. Acquisitions have stretched the balance sheet and could pressure free cash flow, but longer-term the deals give FCX valuable oil-rich assets at a reasonable price to help cut dependence on metals. It's "the best house on a bad block among miners," BB&T says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 5 Comments
  • AXE

    Anixter International (AXE -2.2%) slips after Q2 results miss estimates. Organic sales growth...

    Anixter International (AXE -2.2%) slips after Q2 results miss estimates. Organic sales growth was negative for the quarter and operating income fell 4.6% Y/Y. Operating margin fell 30 bps Y/Y and was flat sequentially. CEO Bob Eck says H1 was "muted by the global macroeconomic climate" and while he believes conditions and trends are improving, he notes that the business environment "will be characterized by low growth." Management is "cautiously optimistic" about H2. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas' (KOG +1.5%) operations update signals robust H2 growth ahead and sets...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas' (KOG +1.5%) operations update signals robust H2 growth ahead and sets up an impressive 2014, KeyBanc says in maintaining its Buy rating and $10.50 price target. A $300M debt issuance reduces the risk of sizable equity issuance should KOG carry out plans to divest $100M$150M of non-core assets by year-end, the firm adds.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 4 Comments
  • SCVL

    Shoe Carnival (SCVL +1.1%) is "a compelling growth story in the small cap space," Sterne Agee...

    Shoe Carnival (SCVL +1.1%) is "a compelling growth story in the small cap space," Sterne Agee says, reiterating a Buy rating and raising the price target on the shares to $30 from $26. Analyst Sam Poser — who "wouldn't be surprised" if Q2 comps come in ahead of the firm's +4% forecast — thinks the company's penetration into the women's non-athletic segment "should increase sales and margins." Also in the bull camp is SA contributor Marshall Hargrave, who says the "market is finally waking up to SCVL's growth potential."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • TST

    P-E firm Spear Point wants to put TheStreet (TST +1.5%) in play and is setting itself up as a...

    P-E firm Spear Point wants to put TheStreet (TST +1.5%) in play and is setting itself up as a bidder, but it doesn't like TST's ownership structure, saying it creates an overhang that makes execution difficult, CNNMoney reports. TST revenues are down nearly 30% since 2008, but Spear thinks it can reinvigorate the brand by cutting costs and taking it out of the public markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • NAT

    Jim Cramer proclaims the oil tanker business could be on the verge of a renaissance, and his...

    Jim Cramer proclaims the oil tanker business could be on the verge of a renaissance, and his favorite way to play it is North American Tankers (NAT +7.8%), pointing to already improving dayrates for Suezmax tankers and VLCCs; he likes the ~7% yield while you wait. "The [Brent-WTI] spread is dead," so Cramer likes several other energy names too: CLR, EOG, WLL, PXD, CXO.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 9 Comments
  • OME

    The sell-off in Omega Protein (OME -10.5%) accelerates, with losses now in the double-digits....

    The sell-off in Omega Protein (OME -10.5%) accelerates, with losses now in the double-digits. Sidoti cut the shares to Neutral from Buy yesterday. The company says it will report Q2 earnings on August 6. SA contributor LongShort 101, whose previous piece sent the stock reeling, was out last week with an update, noting that Peruvian fish meal prices were falling fast. He also raised concerns about OME's menhaden landings catch.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • HERO

    Hercules Offshore (HERO -4%) confirms a "well control incident" on jackup drilling rig Hercules...

    Hercules Offshore (HERO -4%) confirms a "well control incident" on jackup drilling rig Hercules 265 in the Gulf of Mexico, and says efforts are ongoing with client Walter Oil & Gas “to mobilize the necessary resources to regain control.” All personnel on board have been evacuated. Global Hunter is out defending HERO, saying the incident is not a major spill concern.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • BCRX

    BioCryst (BCRX +21.8%) adds University of California faculty member Dr. Fred Cohen to its board....

    BioCryst (BCRX +21.8%) adds University of California faculty member Dr. Fred Cohen to its board. In other company news, shares skyrocket again today, rising sharply after opening lower. Investors are now looking at a 191% month-to-date gain and a 127% move since last Thursday. SA contributor Wonderful Wizard's Friday article is looking rather prescient about now. (Previous: Phase 1 data boosts BCRX)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • PSXP

    Phillips 66 Partners (PSXP +30.6%) flies past $30/share after selling stock in its IPO at $23...

    Phillips 66 Partners (PSXP +30.6%) flies past $30/share after selling stock in its IPO at $23 each (which itself was raised from earlier guidance of $19-$21). Phillips 66 (PSX +2.5%) remains an owner of more than 70% of the spinoff.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 6 Comments
  • NEON

    Neonode (NEON +8.2%) soars after announcing a licensing deal with an unnamed South Korean...

    Neonode (NEON +8.2%) soars after announcing a licensing deal with an unnamed South Korean "global consumer electronics OEM" (Samsung or LG is a good bet). for its MultiSensing touch/proximity-sensing IP. No details on deal terms or which products MultiSensing will be used in (Neonode only says it'll be go into "high-volume consumer applications"). 18% of the float was shorted as of June 28.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • RAI

    Weakness in Reynolds America (RAI -2.3%), Altria (MO -2.6%), and Lorillard (LO -4.3%) following...

    Weakness in Reynolds America (RAI -2.3%), Altria (MO -2.6%), and Lorillard (LO -4.3%) following FDA guidance on the dangers of menthol cigarettes is likely a buying opportunity Wells Fargo says. The language used by the FDA is "somewhat softer than the menthol language from TPSAC's recommendation," analyst Bonnie Herzog notes, adding that this suggests "a ban is very unlikely." Asked about the report on this morning's call, MO CEO Martin Barrington said: "I heard about the headline when I walked into the room and was focused on the call, so I haven't looked at any of this." (Also: MO earnings, CC transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 3 Comments
  • BIIB

    Shares of Biogen (BIIB -2.6%) are under pressure as the company investigates the death of a...

    Shares of Biogen (BIIB -2.6%) are under pressure as the company investigates the death of a patient who took the MS drug Tecfidera. "We are actively investigating," a company spokesperson tells Reuters, adding that "the patient was not on Tecfidera at the time of death." BIIB said yesterday that the patient's death was unlikely to be related to the drug. ISI analyst Mark Schoenebaum isn't worried and even reaches into his slightly-dated pop culture reference bag, telling clients to "chillax."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • BTU

    Although coal stocks (KOL +2.3%) remain strong after Peabody Energy (BTU +6.7%) reported better...

    Although coal stocks (KOL +2.3%) remain strong after Peabody Energy (BTU +6.7%) reported better than expected Q3 earnings, Brean Capital believes results are negative for other U.S. producers: BTU cut Australian cost guidance to mid-$70s/ton, a positive for Peabody but "as long as Australian costs decline and producers there don’t have to cut [volumes]... we are unlikely to see a meaningful increase in prices."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • UPI

    Midday top 10 gainers: UPI +42%. IPCI +30%. FIRE +28%. CSE +22%. USU +19%. DLIA +19%. SMSI +16%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: UPI +42%. IPCI +30%. FIRE +28%. CSE +22%. USU +19%. DLIA +19%. SMSI +16%. URRE +16%. PRAN +14%. HSTM +14%. Midday top 10 Losers: CTG -22%. ALGT -13%. HGSH -13%. OME -10%. SPTN -10%. NAFC -10%. EMITF -9%. SILC -9%. DRTX -9%. STM -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • PENN

    Penn National Gaming (PENN -6.9%) shares are in the doldrums after the company missed Q2...

    Penn National Gaming (PENN -6.9%) shares are in the doldrums after the company missed Q2 estimates amid softness in regional gaming trends and bad weather in the Midwest, cut its dividend and lowered its guidance for the year. Other regional casinos also are lower: PNK -5.6%, ISLE -3.2%, BYD -2.9%, CZR -2.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • LXK

    Lexmark (LXK +10.6%) is ripping higher following its Q2 beat, and is giving a lift to bigger...

    Lexmark (LXK +10.6%) is ripping higher following its Q2 beat, and is giving a lift to bigger rival H-P (HPQ +1.3%). Though Lexmark's hardware revenue fell 14% Y/Y to $171M, high-margin supplies revenue fell only 4% to $608M. Meanwhile, software revenue (now 12% of total) rose 23%, aided by a 34% increase for Perceptive Software, and Managed Print Services (19% of total) rose 12%. Both Lexmark and H-P are counting on investments in printing/imaging software and services to offset the long-term threat posed by online/mobile document and photo viewing. Lexmark's Q3 guidance is for a 4%-6% Y/Y revenue drop and EPS of $0.85-$0.95; the consensus is for a 6.7% drop and EPS of $0.94. $20M was spent on buybacks. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • LO

    Cigarette makers sink after the FDA says menthol in cigarettes appears to pose a greater health...

    Cigarette makers sink after the FDA says menthol in cigarettes appears to pose a greater health threat than regular cigarettes and indicates it plans to issue rules based on its findings. The agency says menthol could make young people more likely to smoke by reducing the irritation and harshness of cigarette smoke. Menthol comprises ~30% of the cigarette market. LO -4.2%, RAI -2.6%, MO -2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 16 Comments
  • BNNY

    Annie's (BNNY -7.2%) dives following a downgrade to Neutral from JPMorgan. The firm has lowered...

    Annie's (BNNY -7.2%) dives following a downgrade to Neutral from JPMorgan. The firm has lowered its estimates, and thinks rivals stand to take share from the organic pasta/snack maker.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • R

    More on Ryder System's (R -1.8%) Q2: CEO Robert Sanchez says economic conditions continue to be...

    More on Ryder System's (R -1.8%) Q2: CEO Robert Sanchez says economic conditions continue to be "uncertain" but notes the company is delivering strong results regardless. Lower rental demand in the U.K. "partially offset" solid demand in the U.S. for the company's commercial rental product. The "vehicle replacement cycle" drove "strong performance" in the full service lease business. FY13 outlook: Management ups the lower end of guidance and now sees EPS of $4.75-4.85. For Q3 the company says it should earn between $1.41-1.46/ share. Analysts expect both full year and Q3 results to come in at the very top end of R's guidance. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • SOL

    ReneSola (SOL +5%) adds to yesterday's gains after announcing state-backed credit insurance...

    ReneSola (SOL +5%) adds to yesterday's gains after announcing state-backed credit insurance provider Sinosure has given it a AAA credit rating. The credit-worthiness of some Chinese solar manufacturers has come under fire thanks to balance sheet issues and Suntech's bankruptcy and fraud scandal. Shares now +185% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • BPZ

    BPZ Energy (BPZ +2.2%) has spudded the first development well on the Corvina field CX-15...

    BPZ Energy (BPZ +2.2%) has spudded the first development well on the Corvina field CX-15 platform on Block Z-1 offshore Peru. Drilling and completion is expected to take as long as 12 weeks; targeted depth is 7,400 ft. subsea.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • TI

    Telecom Italia (TI +8.4%), Orange (ORAN +2.8%), and Portugal Telecom (PT-OLD +3.9%) jump...

    Telecom Italia (TI +8.4%), Orange (ORAN +2.8%), and Portugal Telecom (PT-OLD +3.9%) jump following news Telefonica Deutschland and KPN's E-Plus German unit are merging. With voice/text revenues plunging across the continent thanks to macro weakness and the popularity of VoIP/Web messaging services such as WhatsApp and Skype, investors are hoping consolidation will strengthen debt-laden telcos by delivering cost savings and relieving price pressure. But the EU appears more interested in seeing M&A happen between carriers serving different markets than the same ones, and will likely give the Telefonica/KPN deal close scrutiny.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • HLF

    Fresh off his Yahoo victory lap, Dan Loeb has a little fun at Bill Ackman's expense, touting (in...

    Fresh off his Yahoo victory lap, Dan Loeb has a little fun at Bill Ackman's expense, touting (in a Bloomberg message) a new Herbalife (HLF +0.7%) product: "The Herbal Enema, administered by Uncle Carl." The stock today has risen to its highest level since David Einhorn famously joined a company earnings call in May 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 57 Comments
  • IONS

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS -3.6%) takes a hit today after Piper's Ted Tenthoff cuts the shares...

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS -3.6%) takes a hit today after Piper's Ted Tenthoff cuts the shares to Underweight (he does raise his price target, but at $20, it still doesn't inspire much confidence). The analyst says the shares are overvalued given the company's "limited ownership" of its pipeline assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 4 Comments
  • PFPT

    A few security software names are getting a lift from the Cisco/Sourcefire deal, as investors...

    A few security software names are getting a lift from the Cisco/Sourcefire deal, as investors bet the deal will spur further M&A activity (whether from Cisco or another IT giant). PFPT +5.5%. IMPV +3.6%. QLYS +1.8%. Fortinet is still up strongly (previous), but Palo Alto Networks (PANW +0.7%) has given up nearly all its gains, as M&A enthusiasm is tempered by concerns Sourcefire and its advanced intrusion-analysis tech will better position Cisco to compete against Palo Alto's next-gen firewalls and related security services.Of course, tying together disparate pieces of hardware and software into an integrated security platform can be easier said than done.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy (BTU +5.2%) says it will cut 170 jobs across Australia, or ~5.7% of its total...

    Peabody Energy (BTU +5.2%) says it will cut 170 jobs across Australia, or ~5.7% of its total workforce in the country, and will not fill ~230 current vacancies as it looks to reduce costs. The cuts, which started Monday, will take place across BTU's operations in the coal-rich eastern Australian states of Queensland and New South Wales, where it produces both coking and thermal coal.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • TEVA

    In response to an aging global population (and possibly in an effort to replace lost Copaxone...

    In response to an aging global population (and possibly in an effort to replace lost Copaxone revenue), Teva (TEVA +2%) is investing $15M over five years in the development of new treatments for diseases such as Alzheimer's, Huntington's, and Parkinson's. "I am convinced that this effort will yield not just one or two drugs but will yield a great understanding how the brain works," CEO Jeremy Levin says. (PR, Reuters)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 4 Comments
  • HMA

    Health Management Associates (HMA -3.5%) slides after CNBC's David Faber says HCA Holdings (HCA...

    Health Management Associates (HMA -3.5%) slides after CNBC's David Faber says HCA Holdings (HCA -0.8%) will likely not bid for the company. Along with Community Health Systems and LifePoint Hospitals, HCA was mentioned earlier this month as a possible buyer.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • LEU

    USEC (USU -10.6%) gives back a chunk of yesterday's huge gains inflated by thin liquidity and...

    USEC (USU -10.6%) gives back a chunk of yesterday's huge gains inflated by thin liquidity and short covering, a technical move with "no real fundamental basis." In the news today is Tepco's first-ever statement that radioactive water at the damaged Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant may be seeping directly out of the ground near the ocean. URRE +8.8%, URZ -2.8%, CCJ -1.8%, URA +0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 1 Comment

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes: 1) Broadcom (BRCM -5.3%) has been cut to Sector...

  • Chinese Premier Li Keqiang has reportedly indicated that his government will act to stimulate...

    Chinese Premier Li Keqiang has reportedly indicated that his government will act to stimulate the economy if it slows too much, saying that the bottom line for growth is 7% and that the country can't tolerate anything below that. The remarks somewhat contradict those from Finance Minister Lou Jiwei, who said recently that 6.5% growth would be tolerable. Notwithstanding, Li's comments helped Chinese shares (FXI) jump 2.3% and those in Hong Kong (EWH) 2.2%.
